revised_title: Exploring the Balloon-like Structure of Mammalian Erythrocytes
tldr: The authors investigate the structure of mammalian erythrocytes and compare their behavior to a balloon. They demonstrate that the red blood cells change shape when their volume increases, similar to a balloon-like structure, and not like a solid body. This study helps to understand the unique properties of erythrocytes and their role in the human body.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Cell Biology
